page.title: 05DARTMOUTH FERRIES (2)
page.content: The passenger ferry vessels operate between Dartmouth and Kingswear. The{'ADRIAN GILBERT'}is the regular ferry vessel with the{'EDGCUMBE BELLE' as back up vessel. They were purpose built between{1955}and{1957}by Blackmore, the North Devon ship builder. They are 55 feet in length, with a capacity of 152 plus 2 crew. They carry 14 foot oars to allow them to be rowed in an emergency. The boats were once owned by {British Rail}who ran the service at Dartmouth (the only station without a track), but were taken over by the South Hams Council when British Rail provincial lines closed. Dart Pleasure Craft took over the service in 1977. The{pontoons}have been standing for approximately 12O years until the Dartmouth pontoon was demolished this year,1985.
